problem_text: In \triangle P Q R, Z Q = 3 a - 11, Z P = a + 5, P Y = 2 c - 1, Y R = 4 c - 11, m \angle P R Z = 4 b - 17, m \angle Z R Q = 3 b - 4, m \angle Q Y R = 7 b + 6, and m \angle P X R = 2 a + 10. If Q Y is a perpendicular bisector of P R, find b.
compact_text: In \triangle PQR, ZQ = 3a-11, ZP = a+5, PY = 2c-1, YR = 4c-11, m \angle PRZ = 4b-17, m \angle ZRQ = 3b-4, m \angle QYR = 7b+6, and m \angle PXR = 2a+10. If QY is a perpendicular bisector of PR, find b.
annotat_text: In $\triangle PQR$, $ZQ=3a-11$, $ZP=a+5$, $PY=2 c-1$, $YR=4 c-11$, $m \angle PRZ=4 b-17$, $m \angle ZRQ=3 b-4$, $m \angle QYR=7 b+6$, and $m \angle PXR=2 a+10$.  If $\widetilde{Q Y}$ is a perpendicular bisector of $\overline{P R}$, find $b$.
